  4283                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4284                                  ;									:
  4285                                  ;	System initialization						:
  4286                                  ;									:
  4287                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  4288                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  4289                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  4290                                  ;									:
  4291                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  4292                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  4293                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  4294                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  4295                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  4296                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  4297                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  4298                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  4299                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  4300                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  4301                                  ;		this program.						:
  4302                                  ;									:
  4303                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4304                                  
  4305                                  ; 01/10/2022
  4306                                  ; 08/01/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4307

  4321 000016D7 80                      rom_drv_num:	db 80h			; rom drive number
  4322 000016D8 0002                    md_sectorsize:	dw 200h			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  4323 000016DA 0000                    temp_cluster:	dw 0			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  4324 000016DC FFFF                    last_fat_sec_num: dw 0FFFFh		; used by get_fat_sector proc.

  4384                                  ; the following are the recommended bpbs for the media that we know of so far.

  4388                                  ;   resb 1

  4391                                  ;   resw 1

  4407                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0) IO.SYS
  4408                                  
  4409                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4410                                  BPB48T:
  4411                                  ;bpb48t:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 720, 0FDh, 2, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4412                                  		; 48 tpi diskettes	;
  4413                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4414                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4415                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4416                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4417                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4418                                  		dw	720 ; 2*9*40	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4419                                  		db	0FDh		; media descriptor
  4420                                  		dw	2		; number of fat sectors
  4421                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4422                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4423                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4424                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4425                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4426                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)					
  4427                                  
  4428                                  		db 90h
  4429                                  ;align 2
  4430                                  BPB96T:
  4431                                  ;bpb96t:	; bpbx <512, 1, 1, 2, 224, 2400, 0F9h, 7, 15, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4432                                  		; 96 tpi diskettes	;
  4433                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4434                                  		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4435                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4436                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4437                                  		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4438                                  		dw	2400 ; 2*15*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4439                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4440                                  		dw	7		; number of fat sectors
  4441                                  		dw	15		; sectors per track
  4442                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4443                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4444                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4445                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4446                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4447                                  
  4448                                  		db 90h
  4449                                  ;align 2
  4450                                  BPB35:
  4451                                  ;bpb35:		; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 1440, 0F9h, 3, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4452                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 720 KB ;		
  4453                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4454                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4455                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4456                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4457                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4458                                  		dw	1440 ; 2*9*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4459                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4460                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4461                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4462                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4463                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4464                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4465                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4466                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4467                                  
  4468                                  		db 90h
  4469                                  ;align 2
  4470                                  
  4471                                  ;align 2
  4472                                  ;BPB144:
  4473                                  ;bpb144:	; Retro DOS v4.0 feature only !	; 1.44MB diskettes
  4474                                  ;

  4476                                  ;		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4477                                  ;		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4478                                  ;		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4479                                  ;		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4480                                  ;		dw	2880 ; 2*18*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4481                                  ;		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4482                                  ;		dw	9		; number of fat sectors
  4483                                  ;		dw	18		; sectors per track
  4484                                  ;		dw	2		; heads
  4485                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4486                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4487                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4488                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4489                                  ;
  4490                                  ;		db 90h
  4491                                  ;align 2
  4492

  4494                                  ;bpb288:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 240, 5760, 0F0h, 9, 36, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0>
  4495                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 2.88 MB ;	 
  4496                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4497                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4498                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4499                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4500                                  		dw	240		; number of directory entries
  4501                                  		dw	5760 ; 2*36*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4502                                  		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4503                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4504                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4505                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4506                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4507                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4508                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4509                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4510                                  
  4511                                  		db 90h			;
  4512                                  ;align 2
  4513                                  
  4514                                  %endif
  4515                                  
  4516                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4517                                  					; align	2
  4518                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4519                                  %if 0

  4521                                  		dw bpb96t		; 96tpi	drives

  4523                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4524                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette

  4535                                  %if 0
  4536                                  BPBTABLE:	dw BPB48T		; 48tpi	drives
  4537                                  		dw BPB96T		; 96tpi	drives
  4538                                  		dw BPB35		; 3.5" drives
  4539                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4540                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette

  4551                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4552                                  
  4553                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4554                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4555                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4556                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4557                                  ;
  4558                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4559                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4560                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4561                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4562                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4563                                  ;	  and a retf
  4564                                  
  4565                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4566                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4567                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4568                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4569                                  
  4570                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4571                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4572 00001763 [C800]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4573                                  
  4574                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4575                                  
  4576                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4577 00001765 2EFF36[6317]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4578                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4579 0000176A 2EFF36[E006]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4580 0000176F 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4581 00001770 CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4582                                  
  4583                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4584                                  
  4585 00001771 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4586                                  
  4587                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4588                                  
  4589                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4590                                  
  4591                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4592                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4593                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4594                                  
  4595                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4596                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4597                                  		;=============================================================
  4598                                  		;
  4599                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4600                                  		;
  4601                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4602                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4603                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4604                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4605                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4606                                  
  4607                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4608                                  		;=============================================================
  4609                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4610                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4611                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4612                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4613                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4614                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4615                                  
  4616                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4617                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4618                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs  
  4619                                  		
  4620 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4621                                  
  4622                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4623                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4624                                  		;push	ax
  4625                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4626                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4627                                  		;pop	ax
  4628                                  	
  4629                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4630                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4631                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4632                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4633                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4634                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4635                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4636                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4637                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4638                                  
  4639                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4640                                  
  4641                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4642                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4643                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4644                                  
  4645 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4646 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4647                                  
  4648                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4649                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4650                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4651                                  
  4652 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4653 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4654 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4655 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4656                                  
  4657                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4658                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4659                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4660                                  		; ds = cs
  4661 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4662 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4663                                  		; ds = 0
  4664                                  
  4665 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4666                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4667                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4668                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4669 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4670                                  next_int_:		
  4671 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4672 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4673                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4674 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4675 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4676 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4677 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4678 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4679                                  					; saving address in di
  4680                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4681                                  		;stosw
  4682                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4683                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4684                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4685 00001794 A5                      		movsw
  4686 00001795 A5                      		movsw
  4687                                  
  4688 00001796 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4689 00001798 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4690 0000179A 5F                      		pop	di
  4691 0000179B 59                      		pop	cx
  4692                                  
  4693                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4694                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4695                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4696                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4697                                  
  4698                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4699                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4700                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4701                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4702                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4703                                  
  4704                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4705 0000179C C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4706                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4707                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4708 000017A2 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4709                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4710 000017A6 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4711                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4712                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4713 000017AC 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4714                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4715 000017B0 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4716                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4717                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4718 000017B6 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4719                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4720                                  
  4721                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4722 000017BA 0E                      		push	cs
  4723 000017BB 1F                      		pop	ds
  4724                                  		
  4725 000017BC A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4726 000017BF A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4727 000017C2 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4728 000017C5 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4729                                  					; ;
  4730 000017C8 FB                      		sti
  4731 000017C9 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4732                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4733                                  
  4734                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4735                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4736                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4737                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4738                                  ;
  4739                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4740                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4741                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4742                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4743                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4744                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4745                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4746                                  
  4747                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4748                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4749                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4750                                  ;
  4751                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4752                                  ; to do anything special.
  4753                                  ;
  4754                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4755                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4756                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4757                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4758                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4759                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4760                                  
  4761                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4762 000017CB A801                    		test	al, 1
  4763                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4764 000017CD 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4765                                  
  4766                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4767                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4768                                  ;
  4769                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4770                                  ;
  4771                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4772                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4773                                  
  4774 000017CF 50                      		push	ax
  4775 000017D0 53                      		push	bx
  4776 000017D1 51                      		push	cx
  4777 000017D2 52                      		push	dx
  4778 000017D3 57                      		push	di
  4779 000017D4 06                      		push	es
  4780 000017D5 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4781 000017D7 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4782 000017D9 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4783                                  					; DL = drive number
  4784                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4785                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4786                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4787 000017DB 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4788                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4789                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4790                                  		; ds = cs
  4791 000017DD 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4792                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4793 000017E1 07                      		pop	es
  4794 000017E2 5F                      		pop	di
  4795 000017E3 5A                      		pop	dx
  4796 000017E4 59                      		pop	cx
  4797 000017E5 5B                      		pop	bx
  4798 000017E6 58                      		pop	ax
  4799 000017E7 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4800                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4801                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4802                                  
  4803                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4804                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4805                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4806                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4807 000017E9 A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4808 000017EC 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4809 000017EE 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4810                                  
  4811                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4812                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4813 000017F0 48                      		dec	ax
  4814 000017F1 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4815                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4816                                  
  4817                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4818                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4819 000017F3 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4820 000017F6 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4821                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4822                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4823                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4824 000017F9 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4825                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4826                                  
  4827                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4828 000017FB D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4829 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4830                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4831                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4832                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4833 000017FF 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4834 00001801 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4835 00001803 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4836                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4837                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4838                                  		; ds = cs
  4839 00001804 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4840                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4841                                  notsingle:				
  4842 00001808 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4843                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4844                                  					; booted off hard file
  4845 00001809 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4846                                  
  4847                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4848                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4849                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4850                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4851                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4852                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4853                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4854                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4855                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4856                                  
  4857                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4858                                  
  4859 0000180B F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4860 0000180E 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4861 00001810 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4862                                  gothrd:					
  4863                                  		; 07/10/2023			
  4864                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4865                                  		;			; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4866                                  		;			; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4867                                  		;			; ch = media byte
  4868                                  
  4869                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4870                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h (from MSLOAD)
  4871                                  		;cli
  4872                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4873                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  4874                                  		;sti
  4875                                  
  4876 00001812 51                      		push	cx ; *		; save number of floppies and media byte
  4877 00001813 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4878 00001815 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  4879                                  		
  4880                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4881                                  
  4882 00001816 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4883 00001818 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4884 0000181A 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4885 0000181C 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4886 0000181F 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4887                                  
  4888                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4889                                  		; ds = cs

  5218                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5219                                  ; diskette drives:
  5220                                  ;
  5221                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5222                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5223                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5224                                  ;
  5225                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5226                                  ;
  5227                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5228                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5229                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5230                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5231

  5241                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5242                                  
  5243                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5244                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5245                                  
  5246                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5247                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5248                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5249                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5250                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5251                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5252                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5253                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5254                                  
  5255 0000198A 803E[E116]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  5256 0000198F 750B                    		jnz	short loop_drive
  5257 00001991 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5258                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  5259 00001993 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5260                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  5261 00001995 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; set end of link
  5262 00001999 E90F01                  		jmp	dohard		; allocate/initialise bds for harddrives

  5550                                  ; than two diskette drives

  5553                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5554                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5555                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5556                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5570                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5571                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5572                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5573                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5574                                  ;
  5575                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5576                                  ;
  5577                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5578                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5579                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5580                                  ;use to start with.
  5581                                  ;
  5582                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5583                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5584                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5585                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5586                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5587

  5655                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5656                                  
  5657                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5658                                  ;
  5659                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5660                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5661                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5662                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5663                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5664                                  ; off of it.
  5665                                  ;
  5666                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5667                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5668                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5669                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5670                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5671                                  
  5672                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5673                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5674                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5675                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5676                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5677                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5678                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5679                                  
  5680                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5681 00001B50 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5682                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5683 00001B57 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5684 00001B59 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5685                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  5686 00001B60 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5687 00001B62 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  5688                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  5689 00001B69 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5690                                  
  5691                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  5692                                  
  5693 00001B6B 26A1FBFF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFFBh]	; get year
  5694 00001B6F 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al

  5954                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5955                                  ;
  5956                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5957                                  
  5958                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5959                                  
  5960                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5961                                  ; module name: remap
  5962                                  ;
  5963                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5964                                  ;
  5965                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5966                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5967                                  ;
  5968                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5969                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5970                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5971                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5972                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5973                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5974                                  
  5975                                  ; input:       none
  5976                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5977                                  ; exit error:  none
  5978                                  ; called from: msinit
  5979                                  ;
  5980                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5981                                  ;	  found in the system
  5982                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5983                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5984                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5985                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5986                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5987                                  ;
  5988                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5989                                  
  5990                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5991                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5992                                  
  5993                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5994 00001C66 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5995                                  
  5996                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5997                                  
  5998                                  drive_loop:				
  5999 00001C6B 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6000                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6001 00001C6F 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6002 00001C71 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6003                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6004 00001C73 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  6005 00001C76 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6006 00001C78 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6007                                  
  6008                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6009                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6010                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6011                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6012                                  
  6013                                  fdrv_found:				
  6014 00001C7A B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6015                                  fdrv_loop:				
  6016 00001C7C 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6017                                  					; found	??
  6018 00001C7F 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6019                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6020                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6021                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6022 00001C81 40                      		inc	ax
  6023 00001C82 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  6024 00001C85 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  6025                                  
  6026                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6027                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6028                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6029                                  ; any more.
  6030                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6031                                  
  6032 00001C87 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6033                                  					; get first bds
  6034 00001C8C 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6035                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6036 00001C8E 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6037 00001C93 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6038                                  remap_loop1:				
  6039 00001C96 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6040                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6041 00001C98 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6042 00001C9B FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6043 00001C9D FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  6044 00001C9F 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6045                                  
  6046                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6047                                  
  6048 00001CA1 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6049 00001CA5 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6050 00001CA7 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6051 00001CA9 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6052 00001CAE 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6053                                  
  6054                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6055                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6056                                  
  6057 00001CB0 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6058 00001CB2 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6059                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6060                                  
  6061                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6062                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6063                                  
  6064                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6065 00001CB4 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6066                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6067 00001CB9 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6068 00001CBD FEC0                    		inc	al
  6069 00001CBF 1E                      		push	ds
  6070 00001CC0 BF4F04                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6071                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6072 00001CC3 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6073 00001CC5 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6074                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6075                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6076 00001CC8 1F                      		pop	ds
  6077                                  rmap_exit:				
  6078 00001CC9 C3                      		retn
  6079

  6081
