  9082 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  9083                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  9084                                  					; get port number
  9085 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  9086                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  9087                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  9088 00000362 C3                      		retn
  9089                                  
  9090                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9091                                  
  9092                                  ;************************************************************************
  9093                                  ;*									*
  9094                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  9095                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  9096                                  ;*									*
  9097                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  9098                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  9099                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  9100                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  9101                                  ;*									*
  9102                                  ;************************************************************************
  9103                                  
  9104                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  9105 00000363 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  9106 00000366 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  9107                                  					; zero out buffer
  9108                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  9109                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9110                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  9111 00000369 C3                      		retn
  9112                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9113                                  
  9114                                  ;************************************************************************
  9115                                  ;*									*
  9116                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  9117                                  ;*									*
  9118                                  ;************************************************************************
  9119                                  
  9120                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  9121                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  9122 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  9123                                  aux_loop:				
  9124 0000036C 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  9125                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  9126 0000036F 47                      		inc	di
  9127 00000370 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  9128 00000372 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  9129 00000375 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  9130 00000378 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  9131 0000037A B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  9132 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  9133                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9134                                  
  9135                                  awok:					
  9136 0000037F E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  9137                                  					; still	more character to print
  9138                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  9139                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9140                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  9141 00000381 C3                      		retn
  9142                                  
  9143                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9144                                  
  9145                                  ;************************************************************************
  9146                                  ;*									*
  9147                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  9148                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  9149                                  ;*									*
  9150                                  ;************************************************************************
  9151                                  
  9152                                  getbx:	
  9153 00000382 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  9154                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  9155                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  9156 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  9157                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9158                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  9159 0000038A C3                      		retn
  9160                                  
  9161                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9162                                  
  9163                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9164                                  
  9165                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9166                                  ;								:
  9167                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  9168                                  ;								:
  9169                                  ;								:
  9170                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  9171                                  ;								:
  9172                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9173                                  ;								:
  9174                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9175                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9176                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9177                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9178                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9179                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9180                                  ;								:
  9181                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9182                                  ;								:
  9183                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9184                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9185                                  ;								:
  9186                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9187                                  
  9188                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9189                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9190                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9191                                  
  9192                                  ;19/07/2019
  9193                                  ;09/03/2019
  9194                                  
  9195                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9196                                  
  9197                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9198                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9199                                  
  9200 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9201 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9202 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9203 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9204 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9205 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9206 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9207 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9208 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9209 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9210 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9211 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9212 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9213 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9214 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9215                                  
  9216                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9217                                  
  9218 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9219 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9220 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9221 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9222 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9223 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9224 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9225 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9226 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9227 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9228 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9229 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9230 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9231 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9232 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9233 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9234 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9235 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9236 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9237 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9238                                  
  9239                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9240                                  
  9241                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9242                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9243                                  
  9244                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9245                                  ;
  9246                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9247                                  ;
  9248                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9249                                  ;
  9250                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9251                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9252                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9253                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9254                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9255                                  ;
  9256                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9257                                  ;
  9258                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9259                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9260                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9261                                  ;
  9262                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9263                                  
  9264                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9265 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9266 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9267                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9268 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9269                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9270 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9271 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9272                                  					; get binary hours
  9273                                  					; convert to bcd
  9274 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9275                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9276 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9277 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9278 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9279                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9280 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9281 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9282 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9283                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9284 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9285 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9286 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9287 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9288 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9289                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9290                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9291                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9292 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9293                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9294 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9295 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9296                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9297 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9298                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9299                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9300                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9301 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9302 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9303 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9304                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9305                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9306                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9307 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9308 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9309                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9310 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9311 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9312 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9313                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9314                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9315 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9316 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9317 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9318                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9319                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9320                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9321 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9322                                  no_cmos_2:
  9323                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9324                                  		; cf=0				
  9325                                  		;clc
  9326 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9327                                  
  9328                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9329                                  
  9330                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9331                                  
  9332                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9333                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9334                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9335                                  ;
  9336                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9337                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9338                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9339                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9340                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9341                                  ;
  9342                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9343                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9344                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9345                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9346                                  
  9347                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9348 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9349 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9350                                  
  9351                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9352                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9353                                  ;
  9354                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9355                                  ;	       ----------------
  9356                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9357                                  ;
  9358                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9359                                  ;
  9360                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9361                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9362                                  ;		1,193,180
  9363                                  ;
  9364                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9365                                  ;
  9366                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9367                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9368                                  ;		59,659
  9369                                  ;
  9370                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9371                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9372                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9373                                  ;
  9374                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9375                                  ; multiply by 5
  9376                                  
  9377 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9378 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9379                                  					; multiply by 5
  9380 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9381 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9382 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9383 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9384 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9385 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9386 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9387                                  
  9388                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9389                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9390                                  
  9391 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9392 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9393                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9394 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9395 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9396 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9397                                  
  9398                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9399                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9400                                  
  9401 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9402 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9403                                  
  9404                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9405                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9406                                  
  9407 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9408 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9409 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9410 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9411                                  noadj:					
  9412 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9413 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9414                                  
  9415                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9416                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9417                                  
  9418 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9419 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9420 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9421 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9422 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9423 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9424 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9425 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9426                                  
  9427                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9428                                  
  9429 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9430 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9431 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9432 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9433 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9434 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9435 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9436 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9437 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9438                                  
  9439                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9440                                  
  9441                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9442                                  
  9443                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9444                                  ;
  9445                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9446                                  ;
  9447                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9448                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9449                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9450                                  ;
  9451                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9452                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9453                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9454                                  ;			else
  9455                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9456                                  ;		}
  9457                                  ;
  9458                                  ; USES : AX
  9459                                  ;
  9460                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9461                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9462                                  ;
  9463                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9464                                  
  9465                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9466                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9467 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9468 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9469                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9470                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9471                                  					; midnight
  9472                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9473 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9474 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9475 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9476                                  					; and not flag
  9477 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9478 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9479                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9480                                  
  9481                                  inc_case:				
  9482 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9483 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9484 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9485                                  no_rollover:				
  9486 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9487

  9490                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9492                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9493

  9495                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9496                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0

  9499                                  
  9500                                  ;struc BPB_TYPE

  9515                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9516                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9517                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9518                                  
  9519                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9520                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9521                                  
  9522                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9523                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9524                                  
  9525                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9526                                  
  9527                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9528                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9529                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9530                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9531                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9532                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9533                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9534                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9535                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9536                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9537                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9538                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9539                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9540                                  
  9541                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9542                                  
  9543                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9544                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9545                                  ;
  9546                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9547                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9548                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9549                                  ;   else
  9550                                  ;	set slow = value
  9551                                  ;   ...
  9552                                  ;*********************************************
  9553                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9554                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9555                                  ;*	 use slow
  9556                                  ;*   else
  9557                                  ;*	 use fast
  9558                                  ;*********************************************
  9559                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9560                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9561                                  ;	use slow
  9562                                  ;   else
  9563                                  ;	use fast
  9564                                  ;   ...
  9565                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9566                                  ;
  9567                                  ;
  9568                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9569                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9570                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9571                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9572                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9573                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9574                                  
  9575                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9576                                  
  9577                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9578                                  
  9579                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9580                                  
  9581                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9582                                  ;	command jump table
  9583                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9584                                  
  9585 00000495 00                      		db 0
  9586                                  
  9587                                  ; 11/12/2022
  9588                                  %if 0
  9589                                  
  9590                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9591                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9592                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init

  9599                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9600                                  		dw 849h			; dsk_writ

  9602                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9603                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9604                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9605                                  		dw 80Ah			; dsk_open
  9606                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close
  9607                                  		dw 831h			; dsk_rem
  9608                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9609                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9610                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9611                                  		dw 0C6Bh		; do_generic_ioctl
  9612                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9613                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9614                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9623 00000496 1A                      dsktbl:		db (dtbl_siz-1)/2	; 26 ; this is the size of the table
  9624 00000497 [C316]                  		dw dsk_init
  9625 00000499 [DF04]                  		dw media_chk
  9626 0000049B [8505]                  		dw get_bpb
  9627 0000049D [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr

  9631 000004A5 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear

  9641 000004B9 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9642 000004BB [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear

  9644 000004BF [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9645 000004C1 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9646 000004C3 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear

  9650                                  
  9651                                  dtbl_siz equ $-dsktbl
  9652                                  
  9653                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9654                                  
  9655                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9656                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9657                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9658                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9659                                  ;
  9660                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9661                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9662                                  
  9663                                  SetDrive:	
  9664                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9665 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9666                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9667 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9668 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9669 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9670 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9671 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9672 000004DD F9                      		stc
  9673                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9674 000004DE C3                      		retn
  9675                                  
  9676                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9677                                  
  9678                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9679                                  
  9680                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9681                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9682                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9683                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9684                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9685                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9686                                  
  9687                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9688 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9689 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9690 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9691                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9692 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9693                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9694 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9695                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9696                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9697 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9698                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9699 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9700                                  					; fnon_removable
  9701 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9702 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9703 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9704                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9705                                  
  9706                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9707                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9708 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9709 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9710                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9711 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9712                                  
  9713                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9714                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9715                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9716                                  
  9717 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9718 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9719 00000512 E87912                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9720 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9721 00000517 E8C913                  		call	haschange
  9722 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9723                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9724                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9725                                  			
  9726 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9727 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9728 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9729                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9730 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9731 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
  9732 0000052B EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
  9733                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9734                                  
  9735                                  Media_Unk:				
  9736 0000052D 4E                      		dec	si		; ; Return "I don't know"
  9737                                  
  9738                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
  9739                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9740                                  Media_Done:	
  9741                                  		; 19/10/2022			
  9742 0000052E 06                      		push	es
  9743 0000052F C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  9744 00000533 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
  9745 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9746 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
  9747 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
  9748 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9749 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
  9750 00000543 E82F13                  		call	media_set_vid
  9751                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:			
  9752 00000546 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9753                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
  9754                                  ret_carry_clear:			
  9755 0000054B F8                      		clc			; volidok
  9756 0000054C C3                      		retn
  9757                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9758                                  
  9759                                  err_exitj:				
  9760 0000054D E87D06                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
  9761                                  ret81:					
  9762 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
  9763 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9764                                  
  9765                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9766                                  
  9767                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9768                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9769                                  ; drive.
  9770                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9771                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9772                                  ; returns in si:
  9773                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9774                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9775                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9776                                  ;
  9777                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9778                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9779                                  
  9780                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9781                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9782 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9783 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9784 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9785                                  					; get stored time
  9786 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9787 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9788 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9789 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9790 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9791 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9792 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9793 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9794                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9795 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9796 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9797 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9798                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9799                                  
  9800                                  timepassed:				
  9801 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9802                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9803 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9804                                  
  9805                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9806                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9807 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9808                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9809 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9810                                  
  9811                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9812                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9813                                  Err_Exitj2:
  9814 00000583 EBC8                    		jmp	short err_exitj
  9815                                  
  9816                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9817                                  
  9818                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9819                                  
  9820                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9821                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
  9822                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9823                                  
  9824                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9825                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h
  9826 00000585 268A25                  		mov	ah, [es:di]	; get fat id byte read by dos
  9827 00000588 E840FF                  		call	SetDrive	; get the correct bds for the drive

  9972                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9973                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9974                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9975                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9976                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9977                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9978                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9979                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9980                                  ;
  9981                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9982                                  ;
  9983                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9984                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9985                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9986                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9987                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9988                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9989                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9990                                  ;
  9991                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9992                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9993                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9994                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9995

 10161                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10162                                  
 10163                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10164                                  
 10165                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10166                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10167                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10168                                  ;
 10169                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10170                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10171                                  
 10172                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10173                                  
 10174                                  readbootsec:	
 10175 000006B1 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10176 000006B3 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10177 000006B6 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10178 000006B9 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10179 000006BB 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10180                                  
 10181                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10182                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10183                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10184                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10185                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10186                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10187                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10188                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10189                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10190                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10191                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10192                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10193                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10194                                  		; informations
 10195                                  
 10196                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10197                                  
 10198                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10199                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10200                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10201                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10202                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10203                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10204                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10205                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10206                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10207                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10208                                  
 10209                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10210 000006BD A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10211 000006C0 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10212 000006C2 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10213                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10214 000006C4 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10215 000006C6 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10216                                  					; no need for nop
 10217 000006C8 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10218 000006CA 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10219 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10220 000006D1 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10221                                  
 10222                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10223                                  ;
 10224                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10225                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10226                                  ;;
 10227                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10228                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10229                                  ;;
 10230                                  ;;check_signature:
 10231                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10232                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10233                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if single sided medium.
 10234                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10235                                  
 10236                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10237                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10238                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10239                                  
 10240                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10241                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
 10242 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10243                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10244 000006D6 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10245 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10246 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10247 000006DB 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10248 000006DC 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10249                                  
 10250                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10251                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10252                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10253                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10254                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10255                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10256                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10257                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10258                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10259                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10260                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10261                                  
 10262                                  checksinglesided:
 10263                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10264                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10265                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10266 000006DE 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10267 000006E0 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10268 000006E2 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10269 000006E4 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10270 000006E6 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10271 000006EC 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10272 000006EE 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10273 000006F3 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10274                                  
 10275                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10276                                  
 10277                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10278 000006F5 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10279                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10280 000006FA EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10281                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10282                                  
 10283                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10284 000006FC 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10285                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10286                                  movbpb_ret:
 10287                                  gooddsk:				
 10288 000006FD F8                      		clc
 10289                                  err_ret:
 10290 000006FE C3                      		retn
 10291                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10292                                  
 10293                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10294                                  ;err_ret:				
 10295                                  		;retn
 10296                                  
 10297                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10298                                  
 10299                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10300                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10301                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10302                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10303                                  ;
 10304                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10305                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10306                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10307                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10308                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10309                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10310                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10311                                  
 10312                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10313                                  
 10314                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10315                                  movbpb:	
 10316 000006FF 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10317                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10318                                  					; sectors per unit
 10319 00000703 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10320                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10321                                  					; number of directory entries
 10322 00000707 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10323                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10324                                  					; size of drive
 10325 0000070B 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10326                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10327                                  					; media	descriptor
 10328 0000070F A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10329                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10330                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10331 00000712 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10332                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10333                                  					; sectors per track
 10334 00000716 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10335                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10336                                  					; number of heads
 10337 0000071A 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10338 0000071F 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10339 00000721 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10340 00000724 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10341 00000726 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10342                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10343 0000072B 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10344 00000730 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10345 00000732 E8A811                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10346                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10347                                  		; cf = 0
 10348                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10349                                  		;clc
 10350 00000735 C3                      		retn
 10351                                  
 10352                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10353                                  
 10354                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10355                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10356                                  ;by es:di.
 10357                                  
 10358                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10359                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10360                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10361                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10362                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10363                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10364                                  
 10365                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10366                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10367 00000736 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10368                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10369                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10370 0000073B 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10371 0000073D 51                      		push	cx
 10372 0000073E 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10373                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10374 00000742 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10375 00000746 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10376                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10377 0000074A 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10378 0000074E 57                      		push	di
 10379 0000074F 56                      		push	si
 10380 00000750 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10381 00000753 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10382                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10383                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10384 00000756 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10385 00000759 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10386                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10387                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10388 0000075B B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10389 0000075D BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10390                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10391 00000760 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10392 00000763 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10393 00000765 5E                      		pop	si
 10394 00000766 5F                      		pop	di
 10395 00000767 59                      		pop	cx
 10396                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10397                                  		; cf = 0
 10398                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10399                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10400 00000768 C3                      		retn
 10401                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10402                                  
 10403                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10404 00000769 F9                      		stc
 10405 0000076A C3                      		retn

 10408                                  
 10409                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10410                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10411                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10412                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10413                                  ; output:
 10414                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10415                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10416                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10417                                  
 10418                                  readfat:	
 10419                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10420                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10421 0000076B 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10422 0000076D B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10423                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10424 00000770 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10425 00000773 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10426 00000775 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10427                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10428 00000777 C3                      		retn
 10429                                  
 10430                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10431                                  
 10432                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10433                                  
 10434                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10435                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10436                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10437                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10438                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10439                                  ;		dh has head
 10440                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10441                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10442                                  ;
 10443                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10444                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10445                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10446                                  ;
 10447                                  ;		carry set
 10448                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10449                                  ;
 10450                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10451                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10452                                  
 10453                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10454                                  
 10455                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10456                                  read_sector:	
 10457 00000778 55                      		push	bp
 10458 00000779 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10459 0000077C 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10460 00000780 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10461                                  rd_ret:					
 10462 00000783 06                      		push	es
 10463 00000784 1E                      		push	ds
 10464 00000785 07                      		pop	es
 10465 00000786 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10466 00000789 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10467                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10468                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10469                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10470 0000078B 07                      		pop	es
 10471 0000078C 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10472                                  rd_rty:					
 10473 0000078E E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10474 00000791 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10475 00000793 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10476                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10477                                  					; fnon_removable
 10478 00000798 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10479 0000079A 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10480 0000079F 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10481 000007A1 50                      		push	ax
 10482 000007A2 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10483 000007A3 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10484                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10485                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10486                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10487                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10488 000007A7 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10489 000007A9 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10490                                  		; 
 10491 000007AC 1F                      		pop	ds
 10492 000007AD A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10493 000007B0 58                      		pop	ax
 10494                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10495 000007B1 06                      		push	es
 10496 000007B2 1E                      		push	ds
 10497 000007B3 07                      		pop	es
 10498 000007B4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10499 000007B7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10500                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10501                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10502                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10503 000007B9 07                      		pop	es
 10504 000007BA 9C                      		pushf
 10505 000007BB 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10506 000007C0 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10507 000007C2 50                      		push	ax
 10508 000007C3 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10509 000007C6 1E                      		push	ds
 10510 000007C7 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10511 000007CB 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10512 000007CE 1F                      		pop	ds
 10513 000007CF 58                      		pop	ax
 10514                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10515 000007D0 9D                      		popf
 10516 000007D1 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10517 000007D3 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10518                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10519                                  
 10520                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10521 000007D5 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10522                                  					; return error
 10523 000007D7 F9                      		stc
 10524                                  
 10525                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10526                                  ; track accessed in that drive.

 10528                                  okret2:

 10644                                  checksingle:		
 10645 0000083A 50                      		push	ax
 10646 0000083B 53                      		push	bx
 10647 0000083C 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10648                                  
 10649                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.

 10757                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10758                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10759                                  ;
 10760                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10761                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10762                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10763                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10764                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10765                                  ;	ds = cs
 10766                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10767                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10768                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10769                                  ;
 10770                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10771                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code

 10774                                  diskrd:
