 13450 0000131B C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13451                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13452                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13453                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13454                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13455 0000131F CF                      		iret
 13456                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13457                                  
 13458                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13459                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13460                                  
 13461                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13462                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13463                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13464                                  
 13465                                  win386call:				
 13466 00001320 1E                      		push	ds
 13467 00001321 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13468                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13469                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13470 00001326 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13471                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13472 00001328 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13473 0000132A 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13474                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13475 0000132C 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13476                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13477 0000132E F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13478                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13479 00001331 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13480                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13481 00001333 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13482 00001338 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13483                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13484                                  
 13485                                  Win386Init:	
 13486                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13487 0000133A F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 13488                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13489 0000133D 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13490                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13491 0000133F 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13492                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13493                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13494 00001344 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 13495 00001348 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 13496                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 13497 0000134C BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 13498 0000134F 1E                      		push	ds
 13499 00001350 07                      		pop	es
 13500                                  win_iret:
 13501 00001351 1F                      		pop	ds
 13502                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13503                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13504                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13505 00001352 CF                      		iret
 13506                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13507                                  
 13508                                  handle_multmult:			
 13509 00001353 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13510 00001355 7514                    		jnz	short try_2
 13511 00001357 1E                      		push	ds
 13512 00001358 E84500                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13513                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13514                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13515                                  		;dec	bx
 13516 0000135B BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13517 0000135E 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13518 00001360 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13519 00001362 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13520 00001364 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13521 00001366 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13522 00001368 43                      		inc	bx
 13523                                  try_1:
 13524 00001369 1F                      		pop	ds
 13525                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13526                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13527 0000136A CF                      		iret
 13528                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13529                                  
 13530                                  try_2:					
 13531 0000136B 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13532 0000136D 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13533 0000136F 1E                      		push	ds
 13534                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13535                                  		;xor	di, di
 13536                                  		;dec	di
 13537 00001370 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13538 00001373 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13539 00001375 E82800                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13540 00001378 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13541 0000137B 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13542 0000137D F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13543 0000137F 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13544 00001381 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13545                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13546                                  		;sub	di, di
 13547                                  		;dec	di
 13548 00001383 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13549                                  		;jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13550                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13551 00001386 1F                      		pop	ds
 13552 00001387 CF                      		iret
 13553                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13554                                  
 13555                                  try_4:					
 13556                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13557 00001388 8B3E[F408]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13558 0000138C 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13559                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13560                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13561 0000138F 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13562                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13563 00001392 011E[F408]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13564 00001396 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13565 00001398 C706[F408]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13566                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13567                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13568                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13569 0000139E 1F                      		pop	ds
 13570                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13571                                  try_3:
 13572                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13573                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13574 0000139F CF                      		iret
 13575                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13576                                  
 13577                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13578                                  ;try_3:					
 13579                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13580                                  
 13581                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13582                                  
 13583                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13584                                  
 13585                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13586                                  ;
 13587                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13588                                  ;
 13589                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13590                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13591                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13592                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13593                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13594                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13595                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13596                                  ;
 13597                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13598                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13599                                  ;
 13600                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13601                                  
 13602                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13603                                  HMAPtr:
 13604 000013A0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13605                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13606 000013A5 8B3E[F408]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13607                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13608 000013A9 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13609 000013AC 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13610 000013AE 803E[FA08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13611                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13612 000013B3 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13613 000013B5 FF1E[F608]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13614                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13615 000013B9 8B3E[F408]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13616                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13617                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13618 000013BD C3                      		retn
 13619                                  
 13620                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13621                                  
 13622                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13623                                  
 13624                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13625                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13626                                  
 13627                                  move_sector:
 13628                                  
 13629                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13630                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13631                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13632                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13633                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13634                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13635                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13636                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13637                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13638                                  ;
 13639                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13640                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13641                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13642                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13643                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13644                                  
 13645 000013BE FC                      		cld
 13646 000013BF 51                      		push	cx
 13647 000013C0 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13648 000013C3 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13649 000013C7 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13650 000013C9 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13651 000013CD 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13652 000013CF F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13653 000013D1 59                      		pop	cx
 13654 000013D2 C3                      		retn
 13655                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13656                                  
 13657                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13658 000013D3 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13659 000013D5 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13660 000013D7 59                      		pop	cx
 13661 000013D8 C3                      		retn
 13662                                  
 13663                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13664                                  
 13665                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13666                                  
 13667                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13668                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13669                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13670                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13671                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13672                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13673                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13674                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13675                                  ;
 13676                                  ; input conditions:
 13677                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13678                                  ;
 13679                                  ; output:
 13680                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13681                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13682                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13683                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13684                                  
 13685                                  check_wrap:	
 13686 000013D9 50                      		push	ax
 13687 000013DA 53                      		push	bx
 13688 000013DB 06                      		push	es
 13689 000013DC 57                      		push	di
 13690 000013DD E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13691 000013E0 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13692                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13693 000013E2 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13694                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13695 000013E7 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13696 000013E9 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13697 000013ED 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13698 000013EF 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13699 000013F2 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13700 000013F4 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13701 000013F6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13702                                  
 13703                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13704                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13705                                  
 13706 000013F8 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13707 000013FA 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13708                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13709 000013FC 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13710 000013FD 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13711                                  					; if on	boundary
 13712                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13713                                  not_on_bound:				
 13714 000013FF 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13715 00001402 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13716 00001404 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13717 00001406 40                      		inc	ax
 13718 00001407 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13719 00001409 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13720                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13721 0000140C 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13722 00001410 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13723                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13724                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13725 00001412 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13726 00001414 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13727 00001415 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13728                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13729 00001417 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13730                                  
 13731                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13732                                  
 13733 00001419 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13734 0000141B 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13735 0000141D 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13736                                  
 13737                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13738                                  
 13739 0000141F 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13740 00001421 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13741 00001423 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13742                                  no_head_bound:				
 13743 00001424 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13744 00001426 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13745 00001427 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13746 00001429 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13747 0000142B 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13748 0000142D 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13749 00001430 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13750 00001432 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13751 00001434 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13752 00001436 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13753 00001438 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13754 0000143A D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13755 0000143C 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13756 0000143E 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13757                                  no_wrap:				
 13758 00001440 F8                      		clc
 13759 00001441 5F                      		pop	di
 13760 00001442 07                      		pop	es
 13761 00001443 5B                      		pop	bx
 13762 00001444 58                      		pop	ax
 13763 00001445 C3                      		retn
 13764                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13765                                  
 13766                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13767 00001446 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13768 00001448 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13769 0000144A EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13770                                  
 13771                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13772                                  
 13773                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13774                                  
 13775                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13776                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13777                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13778                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13779                                  ;
 13780                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13781                                  
 13782                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13783                                  find_bds:	
 13784 0000144C C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13785                                  fbds_1:					
 13786 00001450 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13787 00001454 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13788 00001456 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13789                                  					; go to next bds
 13790 00001459 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13791 0000145C 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13792 0000145E F9                      		stc
 13793                                  fdbs_2:					
 13794 0000145F C3                      		retn
 13795                                  
 13796                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13797                                  
 13798                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13799                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13800                                  doint:
 13801                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13802 00001460 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13803                                  					; get physical drive number
 13804                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13805                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13806                                  		
 13807 00001463 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13808 00001465 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13809 00001467 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13810                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13811 00001469 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13812                                  					; get request code
 13813                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13814 0000146C FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13815                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13816 0000146F 9D                      		popf
 13817                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13818                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13819 00001470 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13820                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13821                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13822 00001475 9C                      		pushf
 13823                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13824 00001476 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13825                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13826                                  dointdone:				
 13827 00001479 C3                      		retn
 13828                                  
 13829                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13830                                  
 13831                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13832                                  
 13833                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13834                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13835                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13836                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13837                                  ;
 13838                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13839                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13840                                  ;
 13841                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13842                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13843                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13844                                  
 13845                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13846                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13847                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13848                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13849                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13850                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13851                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13852                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13853                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13854                                  ;end struc
 13855                                  
 13856                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13857                                  
 13858                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13859                                  ;	ah = function
 13860                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13861                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13862                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13863                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13864                                  ;   output conditions:
 13865                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13866                                  
 13867                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13868                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13869                                  ;
 13870                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13871                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13872                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13873                                  
 13874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13875                                  
 13876                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13877                                  
 13878 0000147A 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13879                                  
 13880                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13881                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13882                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13883                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13884                                  
 13885                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13886                                  
 13887                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13888                                  
 13889                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13890                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13891                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13892                                  
 13893                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13894 0000147E 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13895 00001483 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13896 00001485 53                      		push	bx
 13897 00001486 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13898 00001489 E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13899 0000148C 5B                      		pop	bx
 13900 0000148D EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13901                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13902                                  
 13903                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13904                                  
 13905                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13906                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13907                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13908                                  
 13909                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13910                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13911 0000148F 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13912 00001491 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13913 00001493 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13914 00001494 51                      		push	cx
 13915 00001495 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13916 00001497 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13917 00001499 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13918 0000149B 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13919 0000149F 59                      		pop	cx
 13920 000014A0 58                      		pop	ax
 13921 000014A1 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13922                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13923 000014A3 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13924 000014A4 06                      		push	es
 13925                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13926 000014A5 2EC41E[7A14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13927                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13928                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13929 000014AA 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13930 000014AC 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13931 000014AF 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13932                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13933                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13934 000014B3 07                      		pop	es
 13935 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 13936 000014B5 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13937                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13938                                  
 13939                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13940                                  
 13941                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13942                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13943                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13944                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13945                                  
 13946                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13947 000014B7 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13948                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13949 000014BC 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13950 000014BE 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13951                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13952 000014C3 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13953                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13954 000014C5 50                      		push	ax
 13955 000014C6 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13956                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13957                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13958 000014C8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13959                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13960                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13961 000014CD 58                      		pop	ax
 13962 000014CE EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13963                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13964                                  
 13965                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13966                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13967                                  
 13968                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13969                                  
 13970                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13971                                  
 13972                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13973                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13974                                  
 13975                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13976 000014D0 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13977                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13978                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13979 000014D1 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13980                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13981                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13982                                  
 13983                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13984                                  
 13985 000014D6 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13986 000014D9 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13987 000014DC 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13988                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13989                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13990 000014DE 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13991 000014E3 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13992                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13993                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13994                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13995 000014E5 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13996                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13997                                  		
 13998 000014EA 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13999                                  		
 14000 000014EB 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14001                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14002 000014F0 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14003                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14004                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14005 000014F2 9D                      		popf
 14006 000014F3 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14007                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14008 000014F5 1F                      		pop	ds
 14009 000014F6 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14010                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14011                                  
 14012                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14013                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14014                                  ; a changeline error.
 14015                                  
 14016                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14017 000014F9 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14018                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14019 000014FB 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14020 000014FE 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14021 00001500 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14022 00001502 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14023 00001504 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14024 00001509 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14025                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14026                                  					; never	would
 14027 0000150B 53                      		push	bx
 14028 0000150C BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14029 0000150F E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14030 00001512 5B                      		pop	bx
 14031                                  int13b:					
 14032 00001513 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14033 00001514 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14034                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14035                                  
 14036                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14037                                  
 14038                                  goterr13:				
 14039 00001516 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14040 00001519 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14041                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14042 0000151B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14043 0000151E 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14044 00001520 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14045 00001525 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14046                                  
 14047 00001527 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14048                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14049                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14050                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14051 0000152C 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14052                                  
 14053 0000152E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14054                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14055                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14056 00001530 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14057                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14058                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14059 00001535 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14060 00001538 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14061 0000153A 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14062 0000153C 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14063 0000153E 53                      		push	bx
 14064 0000153F 51                      		push	cx
 14065 00001540 52                      		push	dx
 14066 00001541 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14067                                  loop_ecc:				
 14068 00001544 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14069                                  
 14070                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14071                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14072                                  ;
 14073                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14074                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14075                                  ; track.
 14076                                  ;
 14077                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14078                                  ; this request.
 14079                                  ;
 14080                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14081                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14082                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14083                                  ;
 14084 00001547 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14085                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14086                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14087 0000154A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14088                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14089 0000154F 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14090 00001551 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14091 00001554 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14092 00001556 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14093 00001559 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14094                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14095                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14096                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14097 0000155B 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14098                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14099                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14100                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14101                                  ok11_op:				
 14102 0000155D FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14103 00001561 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14104 00001563 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14105                                  					; add 200h to address
 14106 00001565 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14107 00001567 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14108 00001569 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14109                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14110                                  
 14111                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14112                                  
 14113                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14114 0000156B F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14115                                  ok11_exit:				
 14116 0000156C 5A                      		pop	dx
 14117 0000156D 59                      		pop	cx
 14118 0000156E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14119 0000156F EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14120                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14121                                  
 14122                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14123                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14124                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14125                                  
 14126                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14127 00001571 06                      		push	es
 14128 00001572 53                      		push	bx
 14129 00001573 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14130 00001576 1E                      		push	ds
 14131 00001577 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14132 00001578 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14133                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14134                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14135 0000157B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14136                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14137 00001580 5B                      		pop	bx
 14138 00001581 07                      		pop	es
 14139 00001582 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14140 00001584 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14141 00001587 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14142                                  
 14143                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14144                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14145                                  
 14146                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14147 00001589 56                      		push	si
 14148 0000158A 57                      		push	di
 14149 0000158B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14150 0000158D BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14151 00001590 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14152 00001593 5F                      		pop	di
 14153 00001594 5E                      		pop	si
 14154 00001595 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14155                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14156                                  
 14157                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14158                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14159                                  
 14160                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14161 00001597 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14162 0000159A FB                      		sti
 14163 0000159B 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14164 0000159E 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14165                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14166                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14167 000015A0 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14168 000015A3 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14169 000015A5 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14170 000015A8 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14171 000015AA 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14172                                  
 14173                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14174                                  
 14175                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14176                                  
 14177 000015AC 52                      		push	dx
 14178 000015AD 51                      		push	cx
 14179 000015AE 53                      		push	bx
 14180 000015AF 50                      		push	ax
 14181 000015B0 55                      		push	bp
 14182 000015B1 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14183 000015B3 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14184 000015B5 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14185 000015B7 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14186 000015B9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14187 000015BB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14188 000015BD 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14189 000015BF 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14190                                  
 14191                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14192                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14193                                  
 14194 000015C3 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14195 000015C5 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14196                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14197                                  
 14198                                  no_skip_first:				
 14199 000015C8 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14200 000015CA B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14201 000015CC 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14202                                  
 14203                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14204                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14205                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14206                                  ;
 14207                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14208                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14209                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14210                                  ; in error.
 14211                                  
 14212 000015CE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14213 000015D0 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14214                                  
 14215                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14216                                  
 14217 000015D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14218                                  					; set up head number
 14219 000015D5 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14220 000015D8 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14221                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14222                                  
 14223                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14224 000015DB B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14225 000015DD F9                      		stc
 14226 000015DE E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14227                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14228                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14229                                  
 14230                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14231                                  
 14232                                  intverify:				
 14233 000015E1 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14234 000015E2 53                      		push	bx
 14235 000015E3 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14236 000015E4 07                      		pop	es
 14237                                  dosimple:				
 14238 000015E5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14239                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14240                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14241                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14242 000015E8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14243                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14244 000015ED 5B                      		pop	bx
 14245 000015EE 07                      		pop	es
 14246 000015EF E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14247                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14248                                  
 14249                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14250                                  
 14251                                  intformat:				
 14252 000015F2 06                      		push	es
 14253 000015F3 53                      		push	bx
 14254 000015F4 56                      		push	si
 14255 000015F5 57                      		push	di
 14256 000015F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14257                                  
 14258                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14259                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14260                                  
 14261 000015F7 06                      		push	es
 14262 000015F8 1E                      		push	ds
 14263 000015F9 07                      		pop	es
 14264 000015FA 1F                      		pop	ds
 14265 000015FB 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14266 000015FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14267 00001600 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14268 00001603 1F                      		pop	ds
 14269 00001604 5F                      		pop	di
 14270 00001605 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14271 00001606 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14272                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14273                                  
 14274                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14275                                  ; the first block.
 14276                                  ;
 14277                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14278                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14279                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14280                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14281                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14282                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14283                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14284                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14285                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14286                                  
 14287                                  doblock:
 14288                                  
 14289                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14290                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14291                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14292                                  				
 14293 00001608 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14294                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14295 0000160B 51                      		push	cx
 14296 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14297 0000160D 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14298                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14299 0000160E E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14300 00001611 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14301                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14302 00001615 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14303                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14304 0000161A 5F                      		pop	di
 14305 0000161B 07                      		pop	es
 14306 0000161C 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14307 0000161E 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14308 00001620 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14309 00001622 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14310                                  doblockflop:				
 14311 00001624 59                      		pop	cx
 14312                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14313 00001625 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14314 00001627 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14315 00001629 50                      		push	ax
 14316 0000162A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14317 0000162C EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14318                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14319                                  
 14320                                  doblocklast:				
 14321 0000162E 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14322 00001630 50                      		push	ax
 14323                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14324 00001631 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14325 00001634 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14326 00001636 58                      		pop	ax
 14327 00001637 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14328                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14329 0000163A 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14330 0000163C 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14331 0000163E 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14332 00001640 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14333 00001642 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14334                                  					; then we are done already.
 14335 00001644 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14336                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14337 00001646 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14338 00001649 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14339                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14340                                  
 14341                                  bufferx:				
 14342 0000164B 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14343                                  					; set up head number
 14344                                  buffer:					
 14345 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
 14346 0000164F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14347 00001652 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14348 00001655 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14349                                  					
 14350                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14351                                  
 14352 00001657 06                      		push	es
 14353 00001658 1E                      		push	ds
 14354 00001659 56                      		push	si
 14355 0000165A 57                      		push	di
 14356 0000165B 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14357 0000165C 06                      		push	es
 14358 0000165D 1F                      		pop	ds
 14359 0000165E 07                      		pop	es
 14360 0000165F BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14361 00001662 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14362 00001663 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14363 00001665 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14364 00001668 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14365                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14366 00001669 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14367 0000166A 5E                      		pop	si
 14368 0000166B 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14369                                  
 14370                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14371                                  
 14372 0000166C B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14373                                  					; get drive number
 14374 0000166E 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14375 00001671 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14376                                  					;
 14377                                  					; ah is	function
 14378                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14379                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14380                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14381                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14382                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14383 00001674 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14384 00001677 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14385 00001678 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14386 0000167A EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14387                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14388                                  
 14389                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14390                                  
 14391                                  doread:					
 14392 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 14393 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14394 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14395 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14396 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14397 00001683 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14398 00001685 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14399                                  					; get drive number
 14400 00001688 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14401                                  					; ah = function
 14402                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14403                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14404                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14405 0000168B E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14406 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14407 0000168F 07                      		pop	es
 14408 00001690 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14409 00001692 56                      		push	si
 14410 00001693 57                      		push	di
 14411 00001694 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14412 00001696 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14413 00001699 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14414 0000169C 5F                      		pop	di
 14415 0000169D 5E                      		pop	si
 14416                                  
 14417                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14418                                  
 14419                                  dotail:					
 14420 0000169E 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14421 0000169F 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14422 000016A2 41                      		inc	cx
 14423 000016A3 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14424 000016A6 F8                      		clc
 14425 000016A7 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14426 000016A9 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14427                                  
 14428                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14429                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14430                                  
 14431 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14432 000016AE E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14433 000016B1 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14434                                  
 14435                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14436                                  
 14437                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14438                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14439                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14440                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14441                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14442                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14443                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14444                                  
 14445                                  bad13:					
 14446 000016B4 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14447 000016B6 5D                      		pop	bp
 14448 000016B7 5B                      		pop	bx
 14449 000016B8 5B                      		pop	bx
 14450 000016B9 59                      		pop	cx
 14451 000016BA 5A                      		pop	dx
 14452 000016BB 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14453 000016BD E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14454                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14455                                  
 14456                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14457 000016C0 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14458                                  
 14459                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14460                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14461                                  		;db 	0
 14462                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14463                                  
 14464                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14465

 14474                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14475 000016C3 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14476 000016C7 BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14477 000016CA 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14478 000016CB 07                      		pop	es
 14479 000016CC E9E9EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14480                                  
 14481                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14482                                  
 14483                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14484                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14485                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14486                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14487                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14488                                  
 14489                                  install_bds:		
 14490 000016CF 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14491 000016D0 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14492                                  
 14493                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14494                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14495                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14496 000016D3 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14497                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14498 000016D5 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14499 000016D9 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14500                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14501 000016DC 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14502 000016DE B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14503 000016E0 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14504                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14505 000016E4 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14506 000016E7 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14507                                  					; we don't own it
 14508 000016EC 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14509                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14510 000016EF 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14511 000016F2 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14512                                  next_bds:				
 14513                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14514 000016F6 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14515 000016F9 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14516                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14517                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14518 000016FB 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14519 000016FD 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14520                                  					; install bds
 14521 00001700 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14522 00001702 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14523                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14524                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14525 00001705 1F                      		pop	ds
 14526                                  
 14527                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14528                                  ;
 14529                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14530                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14531                                  ;
 14532                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14533                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14534                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14535                                  ;
 14536                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14537                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14538                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14539                                  
 14540 00001706 C3                      		retn
 14541

 14560 00001707 F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14561                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14562 0000170C 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14563                                  		
 14564                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14565                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14566                                  		; 17/10/2022

 14568                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14569                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14570                                  no_win386:				
 14571 00001713 51                      		push	cx
 14572 00001714 52                      		push	dx
 14573 00001715 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14574                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14575                                  
 14576                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 14577                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
 14578                                  
 14579 00001719 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl

 14590                                  
 14591 00001728 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 14592                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14593 0000172B 2E8816[6517]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl
 14594                                  		; 16/10/2022

 14601 00001733 53                      		push	bx

 14604                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14605                                  wrmsg_loop:

 14607                                  					; AL = character to display
 14608 00001738 2E                      		cs

 14611                                  					; get the next character of the	message

 14618                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
 14619 00001745 5B                      		pop	bx
 14620                                  swpdsk9:
