 23402                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23403                                  ; SysParse;
 23404                                  ;
 23405                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23406                                  ;
 23407                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23408                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23409                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23410                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23411                                  ;
 23412                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23413                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23414                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23415                                  ;
 23416                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23417                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23418                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23419                                  ;
 23420                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23421                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23422                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23423                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23424                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23425                                  ;
 23426                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23427                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23428                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23429                                  ;
 23430                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23431                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23432                                  ;
 23433                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23434                                  ;
 23435                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23436                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23437                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23438                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23439                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23440                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23441                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23442                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23443                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23444                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23445                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23446                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23447                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23448                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23449                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23450                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23451                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23452                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23453                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23454                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23455                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23456                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23457                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23458                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23459                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23460                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23461                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23462                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23463                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23464                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23465                                  
 23466                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23467                                  
 23468                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23469                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23470                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23471                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23472                                  
 23473                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23474                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23475                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23476                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23477                                  ;
 23478                                  
 23479                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23480                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23481                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23482                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23483                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23484                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23485                                  
 23486                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23487                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23488                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23489                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23490                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23491                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23492                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23493                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23494                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23495                                  
 23496                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23497                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23498                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23499                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23500                                  ;	     segment.
 23501

 24100                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24101                                  ;
 24102                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24103                                  ;
 24104                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24105                                  ;	    AL = type
 24106                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24107                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24108                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24109                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24110                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24111                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24112                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24113                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24114                                  ;
 24115                                  ; Output:   None
 24116                                  ;
 24117                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24118                                  ;
 24119                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)

 24515                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24516                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24517                                  ;
 24518                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24519                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24520                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24521                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling

 24533                                  
 24534                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24535                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24536

 24547

 25506                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25507                                  ;
 25508                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25509                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25510                                  ;
 25511                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25512                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25513                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25514                                  ;
 25515                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25516                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25517                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25518                                  
 25519                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25520                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25521                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25522                                  ;
 25523                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25524                                  
 25525                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25526                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25527                                  
 25528                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25529                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25530                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25531                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25532 00001C15 BD[2C14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25533                                  
 25534                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25535 00001C18 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25536 00001C1A 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25537                                  
 25538                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25539 00001C1C 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25540 00001C1E 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25541                                  
 25542 00001C20 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25543                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25544                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25545 00001C21 C3                      	retn
 25546                                  
 25547                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25548                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25549                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25550                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25551                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25552                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25553                                  
 25554                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25555                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25556 00001C22 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25557 00001C24 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25558                                  
 25559 00001C26 2E800E[2314]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25560                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25561                                  
 25562                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25563                                  	; cf=0
 25564                                  	;retn
 25565                                  
 25566                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25567                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25568                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25569 00001C2C F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25570                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25571                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25572 00001C2D C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25573                                  
 25574                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25575                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25576                                  ;
 25577                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25578                                  ;
 25579                                  ;  Input:
 25580                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25581                                  ;
 25582                                  ;  Output:
 25583                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25584                                  ;
 25585                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25586                                  ;
 25587                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25588                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25589                                  
 25590                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25591 00001C2E 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25592 00001C2F 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25593 00001C30 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25594                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25595                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25596                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25597 00001C31 2E8B36[2014]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25598 00001C36 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25599 00001C38 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25600 00001C3A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25601 00001C3B 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25602 00001C3C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25603 00001C3D 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25604 00001C3E 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25605 00001C3F 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25606 00001C40 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25607                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 25608                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25609 00001C41 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25610 00001C43 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25611 00001C46 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25612                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25613 00001C48 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25614 00001C4A 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25615 00001C4C 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25616 00001C4D 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25617 00001C4E 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25618 00001C4F 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25619 00001C50 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25620 00001C51 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25621 00001C52 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25622 00001C53 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25623                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25624 00001C55 2E8936[1E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25625 00001C5A 2E891E[2014]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25626                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25627                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25628                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25629                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25630 00001C5F 2EC536[1E14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25631                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25632 00001C64 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25633 00001C67 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25634 00001C69 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25635 00001C6B 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25636 00001C6D 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25637 00001C70 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25638 00001C72 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25639 00001C73 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25640                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25641 00001C75 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25642 00001C76 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25643                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25644 00001C77 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25645                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25646                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25647                                  	; cf=0
 25648                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25649                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25650 00001C79 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25651 00001C7A 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25652 00001C7B 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25653 00001C7C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26207                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26208                                  
 26209                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26210                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26211                                  
 26212                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26213                                  ;
 26214                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26215                                  ;
 26216                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26217                                  ;
 26218                                  ;   Modification log:
 26219                                  ;
 26220                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26221                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26222                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26223                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26224                                  ;
 26225                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26226                                  ;
 26227                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26228                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26229                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26230                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26231                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26232                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26233                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26234                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26235                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26236                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26237                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26238                                  ;
 26239                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26240                                  
 26241                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26242                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26243                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26244                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26245                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26246                                  
 26247                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26248                                  
 26249                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26250                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26251                                  
 26252                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26253                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26254                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26255                                  
 26256                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26257                                  ;
 26258                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26259                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26260                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26261                                  ;	           line.
 26262                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26263                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26264                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26265                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26266                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26267                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26268                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26269                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26270                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26271                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26272                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26273                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26274                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26275                                  ;	           for details).
 26276                                  
 26277                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26278                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26279                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26280                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26281                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26282                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26283                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26284                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26285                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26286                                  
 26287                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26288                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26289                                  
 26290                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26291                                  
 26292                                  %endif
 26293                                  
 26294                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 26303                                  
 26304 00001E60 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26305 00001E62 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26306 00001E64 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26307 00001E66 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26308 00001E6A 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26309                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26310                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26311                                  ;

 26313 00001E6F 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26314 00001E71 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 26341                                  
 26342                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26343                                  
 26344                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26345                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 26346                                  
 26347                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26348                                  ;
 26349                                  ; procedure : doconf
 26350                                  ;
 26351                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 26352                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 26353                                  ;
 26354                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26355                                  
 26356                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26357                                  doconf:
 26358 00001E93 0E                      	push	cs
 26359 00001E94 1F                      	pop	ds
 26360                                  
 26361 00001E95 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 26362                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 26363 00001E98 CD21                    	int	21h
 26364 00001E9A 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 26365                                  
 26366                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26367                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26368                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 26369                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26370                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26371                                  
 26372 00001E9E BA[0333]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26373 00001EA1 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26374                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26375 00001EA4 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26376 00001EA5 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26377 00001EA7 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26378                                  
 26379                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26380                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26381                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 26382                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 26383                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 26384 00001EA9 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 26385 00001EAE C3                      	retn
 26386                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 26387 00001EAF 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 26388 00001EB1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26389 00001EB3 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26390                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 26391 00001EB5 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 26392 00001EB8 CD21                    	int	21h
 26393 00001EBA A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 26394                                  
 26395 00001EBD 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26396                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 26397 00001EBF B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 26398 00001EC2 CD21                    	int	21h
 26399                                  
 26400                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 26401                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26402 00001EC4 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 26403                                  
 26404 00001EC8 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 26405 00001ECB A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26406 00001ECE E8D3F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26407 00001ED1 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26408                                  
 26409                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26410                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26411                                  ;;
 26412                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26413                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26414                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26415                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26416                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26417                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26418                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26419                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26420                                  ;;
 26421                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26422                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26423                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26424                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26425                                  
 26426 00001ED3 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 26427                                  	
 26428                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 26429                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 26430                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26431 00001ED6 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 26432 00001EDA E8E8EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 26433                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26434                                  	; ds <> cs 
 26435 00001EDD 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 26436

 26550                                  %if 0
 26551

 26554                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26555                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26556                                  
 26557                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code

 26559                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh

 26561                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26562                                  
 26563                                          push    ax                      ;
 26564                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26565                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26566                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26567                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26568                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26569                                          pop     ax
 26570                                  ;
 26571                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26572                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26573                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26574                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26575                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26576                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26577                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26578                                  ;   spot.
 26579                                  ;
 26580                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26581                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26582                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26583                                  ;   retrieved.
 26584                                  ;
 26585                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?

 26594                                  not_final:                              ;
 26595                                  ;endif
 26596

 26722                                  
 26723                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26724                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26725                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26726                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26727                                  
 26728                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26729                                  	mov	bx,1
 26730                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26731

 26733                                  
 26734                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26735                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26736                                          int     21h
 26737                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26738                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26739                                          int     21h
 26740                                  
 26741                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26742                                  
 26743                                  %endif

 26762                                  ; buffer command
 26763                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26764                                  
 26765                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26766                                  ;									      *
 26767                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26768                                  ;									      *
 26769                                  ; input :								      *
 26770                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26771                                  ; output:								      *
 26772                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26773                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26774                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26775                                  ;									      *
 26776                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26777                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26778                                  ; logic:								      *
 26779                                  ; {									      *
 26780                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26781                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26782                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26783                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26784                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26785                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26786                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26787                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26788                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26789                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26790                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26791                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26792                                  ;	};								      *
 26793                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26794                                  ; };									      *
 26795                                  ;									      *
 26796                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26797                                  
 26798                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26799                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26800                                  tryb:
 26801 00001FCC 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26802 00001FCF 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26803                                  
 26804                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26805                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26806                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26807                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26808                                  ;;endif
 26809                                  
 26810                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26811                                  	; 18/12/2022
 26812 00001FD1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26813                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 26814 00001FD3 880E[C41C]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 26815                                  
 26816 00001FD7 BF[7D1C]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 26817                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 26818                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26819                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26820                                  do7:
 26821 00001FDA E87506                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26822 00001FDD 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 26823                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26824                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 26825                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 26826                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26827                                  ;sr7:
 26828                                  	;jmp	coff
 26829                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26830 00001FDF E9EE05                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff

 26832 00001FE2 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?

 26834                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 26835 00001FE7 813E[C81C][BD1C]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x

 26868 00002016 A3[9702]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.

 26884                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26885                                  ; break command
 26886                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26887                                  
 26888                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26889                                  ;									    *
 26890                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26891                                  ;									    *
 26892                                  ; input :								    *
 26893                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26894                                  ; output:								    *
 26895                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26896                                  ;									    *
 26897                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26898                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26899                                  ; logic:								    *
 26900                                  ; {									    *
 26901                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 26902                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26903                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26904                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26905                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26906                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26907                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26908                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26909                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26910                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26911                                  ;	};								    *
 26912                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 26913                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *

 26971                                  ; multitrack command
 26972                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26973                                  
 26974                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26975                                  ;									      *
 26976                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 26977                                  ;									      *
 26978                                  ; input :								      *
 26979                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26980                                  ; output:								      *
 26981                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 26982                                  ;									      *
 26983                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26984                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26985                                  ; logic:								      *
 26986                                  ; {									      *
 26987                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 26988                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26989                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26990                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26991                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26992                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 26993                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 26994                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 26995                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 26996                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 26997                                  ;	};								      *
 26998                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 26999                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *

 27001                                  ; };									      *
 27002                                  ;									      *

 28308                                  trypbad:
 28309 000024B7 E9B701                  	jmp	badop
 28310                                  
 28311                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28312                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28313                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28314                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28315                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28316                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28317                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28318                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28319                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28320                                  
 28321                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28322                                  ;									  *
 28323                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28324                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28325                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28326                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28327                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28328                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28329                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28330                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28331                                  ; input :								  *
 28332                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28333                                  ; output:								  *
 28334                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28335                                  ;									  *
 28336                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28337                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28338                                  ; logic:								  *
 28339                                  ; {									  *
 28340                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28341                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28342                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28343                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28344                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28345                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28346                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28347                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28348                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28349                                  ;	     }								  *
 28350                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28351                                  ;	     error exit;						  *

 28789                                  ;***********************************************************************
 28790                                  ;								       *
 28791                                  ; function: parse the option switches specified.		       *

 28793                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 28794                                  ;								       *
 28795                                  ; input :							       *
 28796                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *

 29041                                  ;	 procedure.

 29387                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29388                                  ;
 29389                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29390                                  ;
 29391                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29392                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29393                                  ;
 29394                                  ;	Output : none
 29395                                  ;
 29396                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29397                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29398                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29399                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29400                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29401                                  ;
 29402                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29403                                  
 29404                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29405                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29406                                  	; ds = cs
 29407 000026F7 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29408                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29409                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29410 000026FA E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29411 000026FD 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29412                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29413                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29414                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29415                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29416                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29417                                  	; ds = cs
 29418 000026FF 803E[7D1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29419 00002704 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29420 00002706 A1[641E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29421                                  lim_set:
 29422                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29423                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29424                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29425                                  ;limx:
 29426                                  	;retn
 29427                                  	
 29428                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29429                                  
 29430                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29431                                  ;
 29432                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29433                                  ;
 29434                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29435                                  ;	Output : none
 29436                                  ;
 29437                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29438                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29439                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29440                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29441                                  ;
 29442                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29443                                  
 29444                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29445                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29446 00002709 1E                      	push	ds
 29447 0000270A BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29448 0000270D 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29449 0000270F 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29450 00002713 2E891E[811E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29451 00002718 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29452 0000271A D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29453 0000271C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29454 0000271F 2EC606[801E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29455 00002725 1F                      	pop	ds
 29456                                  ;limx:
 29457 00002726 C3                      	retn
 29458                                  
 29459                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29460                                  ;
 29461                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29462                                  ;
 29463                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29464                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29465                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29466                                  ;
 29467                                  ;	Output : none
 29468                                  ;
 29469                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29470                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29471                                  ;
 29472                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29473                                  
 29474                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29475                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29476                                  	; ds = cs
 29477 00002727 803E[801E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29478                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29479                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29480                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29481 0000272C 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29482                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29483 0000272E B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29484 00002731 8826[801E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29485                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29486                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29487 00002735 1E                      	push	ds
 29488                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29489 00002736 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29490 00002738 2EA1[811E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29491 0000273C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29492 0000273F 1F                      	pop	ds
 29493                                  timx:
 29494 00002740 C3                      	retn
 29495                                  
 29496                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29497                                  ;
 29498                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 29499                                  ;
 29500                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 29501                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 29502                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 29503                                  ;
 29504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29505                                  
 29506                                  IsIt3Com:
 29507                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29508                                  	; ds = cs
 29509 00002741 1E                      	push	ds
 29510 00002742 06                      	push	es
 29511 00002743 56                      	push	si
 29512                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29513 00002744 C536[661E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 29514                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 29515 00002748 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 29516 0000274B 0E                      	push	cs
 29517 0000274C 07                      	pop	es
 29518 0000274D BF[831E]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 29519 00002750 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 29520 00002753 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 29521 00002755 5E                      	pop	si
 29522 00002756 07                      	pop	es
 29523 00002757 1F                      	pop	ds
 29524 00002758 C3                      	retn

 29533 0000275E 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx
 29534 00002760 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 29535                                  	;mov	[2],bx
 29536 00002765 891E0200                	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],bx
 29537 00002769 1F                      	pop	ds
 29538 0000276A C3                      	retn

 29543                                  
 29544                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29545                                  
 29546                                  %if 0
 29547                                  
 29548                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29549                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29550                                  
 29551                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29552                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29553                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29554                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29555                                  
 29556                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29557                                  ;
 29558                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29559                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29560                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29561                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29562                                  ;
 29563                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29564                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29565                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29566                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29567                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29568                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29569                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29570                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29571                                  ; available during the load.
 29572                                  ;
 29573                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29574                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29575                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29576                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29577                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29578                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29579                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29580                                  ;
 29581                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29582                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29583                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29584                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29585                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29586                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29587                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29588                                  ;
 29589                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29590                                  
 29591                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29592                                  
 29593                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29594                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29595                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29596                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29597                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29598                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29599                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29600                                  
 29601                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29602                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29603                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29604                                  
 29605                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29606                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29607                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29608                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29609                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29610                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29611                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29612                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29613                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29614                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29615                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29616                                  
 29617                                  InitVar:
 29618                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29619                                  	push	ax
 29620                                  	push	cx
 29621                                  	push	di
 29622                                  	push	es
 29623                                  
 29624                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29625                                  	push	cs
 29626                                  	pop	es
 29627                                  
 29628                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29629                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29630                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29631                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29632                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29633                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29634                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29635                                  
 29636                                  	cld
 29637                                  
 29638                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29639                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29640                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29641                                  
 29642                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29643                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29644                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29645                                  
 29646                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29647                                  
 29648                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29649                                  	pop	es
 29650                                  	pop	di
 29651                                  	pop	cx
 29652                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29653                                  
 29654                                  	retn
 29655                                  
 29656                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29657                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29658                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29659                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29660                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29661                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29662                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29663                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29664                                  
 29665                                  FixMem:
 29666                                  	push	ax
 29667                                  	push	bx
 29668                                  	push	cx
 29669                                  	push	dx
 29670                                  	push	es
 29671                                  
 29672                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29673                                  
 29674                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29675                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29676                                  
 29677                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29678                                  
 29679                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29680                                  
 29681                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29682                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29683                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29684                                  
 29685                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29686                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29687                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29688                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29689                                  
 29690                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29691                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29692                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29693                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29694                                  
 29695                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29696                                  
 29697                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29698                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29699                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29700                                  
 29701                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29702                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29703                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29704                                  	inc	bx
 29705                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29706                                  
 29707                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29708                                  
 29709                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29710                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29711                                  
 29712                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29713                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29714                                  	inc	bx
 29715                                  	mov	es,bx
 29716                                  
 29717                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29718                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29719                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29720                                  fmX:	
 29721                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29722                                  
 29723                                  	pop	es
 29724                                  	pop	dx
 29725                                  	pop	cx
 29726                                  	pop	bx
 29727                                  	pop	ax
 29728                                  
 29729                                  	retn
 29730                                  
 29731                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29732                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29733                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29734                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29735                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29736                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29737                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29738                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29739                                  
 29740                                  fm_link:
 29741                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29742                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29743                                  
 29744                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29745                                  	;
